chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher E Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 182 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution on this case for Karen H ($200.00) and Associated Bank ($2,368.14) to be paid soley by defendant. Restitution for case 13CM1043 which was dismissed and read in for C.J.'s Automotive ($500.00); Elders Towing ($150.00); Repair Alloy ($100.84) and Waukesha Iron and Metal Inc. ($528.00) to be paid joint and several as a condition of Extended Supervision.
04/28/2021 RECEIVED INFO FROM DA THAT JOINT AND SEVERAL RESTITUTION ($1,278.84) WAS PAID AT SENTENCING BY CO-DEFENDANT N. SCHULTZ. BALANCES ADJUSTED.
Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Continue with AODA treatment and Anger Management treatment. Follow through with mental health treatment as recommeded by Agent.

No Contact with any of the victims in the criminal complaint. No Contact with David R or Ashley W. No violent contact with mother of minor child. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain absolute sobriety. Comply with random urine screens. No use or possession of alchol or drugs or drug paraphernalia or drugs without a valid prescription. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

from the State requesting a modification to restitution.

Defendant Christopher E Hanson in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   Margaret Drees appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court orders the following: 
- Total sentence: 5 years 6 months (Initial Confinement: 2 years 6 months, Extended Supervision: 3 years).  Credit for 182 days.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
- Court costs waived.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision. 
- Restitution of $3,846.98 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision as follows:  for case 14CF400(solely liable):($200.00 to Karen H.; $2,368.14 to Associated Bank), for case 13CM1043(jointly and severally liable): ($500.00 to C.J.'s Automotive; $150.00 to Elders Towing; $100.84 to Repair Alloy; $528.00 to Waukesha Iron and Metal Inc.)
- Conditions of Extended Supervision:  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  No violent contact with mother of minor child.  Continue with AODA treatment and Anger Managment treatment.  Follow through with mental health treatment as recommended by Agent.  No contact with any of the victims in the Criminal Complaint.  No contact with David R. or Ashley W.  DNA Sample if not yet provided, defendant to pay surcharge.
Sentencing hearing on October 8, 2014 at 10:00 am.
